name: Lumpia
instructions: 1. In a pan, heat some oil and sauté the garlic and onion until fragrant.
2. Add the ground pork and cook until browned. Make sure to break it up into small pieces.
3. Add the carrots and cabbage to the pan. Stir-fry for a few minutes until they start to soften.
4. Pour in the soy sauce and oyster sauce. Mix well and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
5. Remove the filling from the heat and let it cool slightly.
6. Take a lumpia wrapper and place a spoonful of the filling in the center.
7. Fold the sides of the wrapper towards the center, then roll it tightly into a cylinder shape. Secure the end with water or beaten egg.
8. Repeat the process until all the filling is used.
9. In a deep pan or frying pan, heat oil over medium-high heat.
10. Carefully place the lumpia in the hot oil and fry until golden brown on all sides.
11. Remove the lumpia from the oil and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
12. Serve the lumpia hot and enjoy with your favorite dipping sauce.
description: Lumpia is a popular Filipino dish consisting of crispy fried spring rolls filled with a savory mixture of ground pork, vegetables, and seasonings. It is a delicious appetizer or snack that is enjoyed by many.
